titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Records of the Office of External Affairs, Commencement and Special Events
1975-1995
RG 7.4 RG 7.4
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by University Archives staff

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from an OCR document

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-11-16T16:53-0500

did.unittitle: Records of the Office of External Affairs, Commencement and Special Events
did.abstract: The Commencement and Special Events division is part of the Office of External Affairs and operates under the leadership of the Vice President for External Affairs. The bulk of the material documents the planning processes of special events and commencement programs spanning the period 1975-1995.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of External Affairs, Commencement and Special Events

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records are organized into two series:

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: There is no information about materials that are associated by provenance to the described materials that have been physically separated or removed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the New York University Archives
relatedmaterial.p: Records of the Office of Radio and Television, 1953-1985
Records of the Office of the Senior Vice President, William F. Payne, for External Affairs, 1968-1980

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains general files and publications generated by the Commencement and Special Events division of the Office of External Affairs. The bulk of the material documents the planning process for university events spanning the period 1975-1995.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Commencement and Special Events division is part of the Office of External Affairs and operates under the direction of the Vice President for External Affairs. The Commencement and Special Events department is responsible for the planning, organization, and overseeing of university events and commencement ceremonies. Other than convocation ceremonies the department regularly organizes university events such as anniversary celebrations, guest lectures, fundraising dinners, and site dedications.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Records of the Office of External Affairs, Commencement, and Special Events; RG 7.4; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
New York University Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2646
Fax: (212) 995-4070
E-mail: university.archives@library.nyu.edu

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The records were accessioned by the University Archives in 1997.
